technologies.name: WordPress
technologies.description: WordPress is a free and open-source content management system written in PHP and paired with a MySQL or MariaDB database. Features include a plugin architecture and a template system.

technologies.name: Plesk
technologies.description: Plesk is a web hosting and server data centre automation software with a control panel developed for Linux and Windows-based retail hosting service providers.

technologies.name: MySQL
technologies.description: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system.

technologies.name: PHP
technologies.description: PHP is a general-purpose scripting language used for web development.

technologies.name: Vimeo
technologies.description: Vimeo is a video hosting, sharing and services platform. Vimeo operation an ad-free basis by providing subscription plans.

technologies.name: Bootstrap
technologies.description: Bootstrap is a free and open-source CSS framework directed at responsive, mobile-first front-end web development. It contains CSS and JavaScript-based design templates for typography, forms, buttons, navigation, and other interface components.

technologies.name: Animate.css
technologies.description: Animate.css is a ready-to-use library collection of CSS3 animation effects.

technologies.name: WPForms
technologies.description: WPForms is a drag and drop WordPress form builder.

technologies.name: The Events Calendar
technologies.description: The Events Calendar is a free event management plugin for WordPress.

technologies.name: jQuery Mobile
technologies.description: jQuery Mobile is a HTML5-based user interface system designed to make responsive web sites and apps that are accessible on all smartphone, tablet and desktop devices.

technologies.name: GSAP
technologies.description: GSAP is an animation library that allows you to create animations with JavaScript.

technologies.name: Yoast SEO
technologies.description: Yoast SEO is a search engine optimisation plugin for WordPress and other platforms.

technologies.name: Google Ads
technologies.description: Google Ads is an online advertising platform developed by Google.

technologies.name: Google Tag Manager
technologies.description: Google Tag Manager is a tag management system (TMS) that allows you to quickly and easily update measurement codes and related code fragments collectively known as tags on your website or mobile app.

technologies.name: Google Ads Conversion Tracking
technologies.description: Google Ads Conversion Tracking is a free tool that shows you what happens after a customer interacts with your ads.

technologies.name: Cloudflare Browser Insights
technologies.description: Cloudflare Browser Insights is a tool that measures the performance of websites from the perspective of users.

technologies.name: Swiper
technologies.description: Swiper is a JavaScript library that creates modern touch sliders with hardware-accelerated transitions.

technologies.name: Lodash
technologies.description: Lodash is a JavaScript library which provides utility functions for common programming tasks using the functional programming paradigm.

technologies.name: Linkedin Insight Tag
technologies.description: LinkedIn Insight Tag is a lightweight JavaScript tag that powers conversion tracking, website audiences, and website demographics.

technologies.name: LazySizes
technologies.description: LazySizes is a JavaScript library used to delay the loading of images (iframes, scripts, etc) until they come into view.

technologies.name: jQuery UI
technologies.description: jQuery UI is a collection of GUI widgets, animated visual effects, and themes implemented with jQuery, Cascading Style Sheets, and HTML.

technologies.name: jQuery
technologies.description: jQuery is a JavaScript library which is a free, open-source software designed to simplify HTML DOM tree traversal and manipulation, as well as event handling, CSS animation, and Ajax.

technologies.name: Isotope
technologies.description: Isotope.js is a JavaScript library that makes it easy to sort, filter, and add Masonry layouts to items on a webpage.

technologies.name: Google Analytics
technologies.description: Google Analytics is a free web analytics service that tracks and reports website traffic.

technologies.name: Facebook Pixel
technologies.description: Facebook pixel is an analytics tool that allows you to measure the effectiveness of your advertising.

technologies.name: Dropzone
technologies.description: Dropzone is a JavaScript library that turns any HTML element into a dropzone.

technologies.name: core-js
technologies.description: core-js is a modular standard library for JavaScript, with polyfills for cutting-edge ECMAScript features.

technologies.name: Choices
technologies.description: Choices.js is a lightweight, configurable select box/text input plugin.

technologies.name: reCAPTCHA
technologies.description: reCAPTCHA is a free service from Google that helps protect websites from spam and abuse.

technologies.name: Priority Hints
technologies.description: Priority Hints exposes a mechanism for developers to signal a relative priority for browsers to consider when fetching resources.

technologies.name: Taboola
technologies.description: Taboola is a content discovery & native advertising platform for publishers and advertisers.

technologies.name: HSTS
technologies.description: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) informs browsers that the site should only be accessed using HTTPS.

technologies.name: Google Workspace
technologies.description: Google Workspace, formerly G Suite, is a collection of cloud computing, productivity and collaboration tools.

technologies.name: Cloudflare
technologies.description: Cloudflare is a web-infrastructure and website-security company, providing content-delivery-network services, DDoS mitigation, Internet security, and distributed domain-name-server services.

technologies.name: Open Graph
technologies.description: Open Graph is a protocol that is used to integrate any web page into the social graph.

technologies.name: HTTP/3
technologies.description: HTTP/3 is the third major version of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol used to exchange information on the World Wide Web.
